name: FINDRISK Diabetes Risk Calculator
description: Finnish Diabetes Risk Score - Predicts 10-year risk of developing Type 2 diabetes

questions.label: Body Mass Index (BMI)
questions.description: Your BMI in kg/m². If you don't know your BMI, you can calculate it: weight (kg) ÷ [height (m)]²

questions.label: Waist Circumference
questions.description: Measure around your waist at the level of your navel

questions.label: Physical Activity
questions.description: Do you usually have at least 30 minutes of physical activity at work and/or during leisure time (including normal daily activity)?

options.label: Yes, at least 30 minutes per day
No, less than 30 minutes per day

questions.label: Daily Vegetables and Fruits
questions.description: Do you eat vegetables, fruits or berries every day?

questions.label: Blood Pressure Medication
questions.description: Have you ever taken medication for high blood pressure on a regular basis?

questions.label: History of High Blood Glucose
questions.description: Have you ever been found to have high blood glucose (e.g., in a health examination, during an illness, during pregnancy)?

questions.label: Family History of Diabetes
questions.description: Have any of your family members been diagnosed with Type 1 or Type 2 diabetes?

options.label: Yes: grandparent, aunt, uncle, or first cousin (but not parent, sibling or child)
Yes: parent, sibling, or own child

riskCategories.name: Low Risk
riskCategories.description: Low risk (1% chance) - Your risk of developing type 2 diabetes within 10 years is estimated to be 1 in 100

riskCategories.name: Slightly Elevated Risk
riskCategories.description: Slightly elevated risk (4% chance) - Your risk of developing type 2 diabetes within 10 years is estimated to be 1 in 25

riskCategories.name: Moderate Risk
riskCategories.description: Moderate risk (17% chance) - Your risk of developing type 2 diabetes within 10 years is estimated to be 1 in 6

riskCategories.name: High Risk
riskCategories.description: High risk (33% chance) - Your risk of developing type 2 diabetes within 10 years is estimated to be 1 in 3

riskCategories.name: Very High Risk
riskCategories.description: Very high risk (50% chance) - Your risk of developing type 2 diabetes within 10 years is estimated to be 1 in 2

references.title: FINDRISK: A practical tool to identify individuals at high risk for type 2 diabetes
Finnish Diabetes Risk Score for screening of undiagnosed type 2 diabetes
Prevention of type 2 diabetes mellitus by changes in lifestyle among subjects with impaired glucose tolerance

metadata.targetPopulation: Adults aged 18 years and older without known diabetes
metadata.clinicalUse: Screening tool for identifying individuals at high risk of developing Type 2 diabetes within 10 years
